title: Bat or bird
data:
The **bat or bird** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the uppercase [B](/wiki/B "B") glyph (B). Bats and birds are designated internally by the macro `S_BAT`.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The class contains the following monsters:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- B [bat](/wiki/Bat "Bat")
- B [giant bat](/wiki/Giant_bat "Giant bat")
- B [raven](/wiki/Raven "Raven")
- B [vampire bat](/wiki/Vampire_bat "Vampire bat")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)
  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

- [4 References](#References)

## Common traits

Bats and birds are [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") animals whose diets include meat. They are visible via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") and capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight"), and generally move erratically: there is a 1⁄3 chance of a bat or bird monster moving in a random direction during each of its turns.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

Bats and birds generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") have slightly higher speed than normal, as a play on the phrase "like a bat \[on its way] out of hell".[\[4\]](#cite_note-batoutofhell-4)

### Generation

Randomly generated bats and birds are typically created hostile with the exception of the standard bat, which may generate as peaceful for a neutral [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero").

The bat or bird is the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard"), and makes up 24⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Wizard quest](/wiki/Wizard_quest "Wizard quest"). Some bats and birds are also generated on a few levels within the quest branch at level creation: ten are generated on the home level, with six placed at specific locations near the pond bank and four further away; twelve are placed randomly on the locate level; and eleven are generated on the goal level.

## History

The standard bat and vampire bat appear in Hack 1.21, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and both monsters use the b glyph. The bat reappears in PDP-11 Hack and [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"), where it begins using the B glyph. [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0") introduces the giant bat and reintroduces the vampire bat, while the raven first appears in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces several new monsters to the monster class:

- B [rhumbat](/wiki/Rhumbat "Rhumbat")
- B [athol](/wiki/Athol "Athol")
- B [hellbat](/wiki/Hellbat "Hellbat")
- B [mongbat](/wiki/Mongbat "Mongbat")
- B [mobat](/wiki/Mobat "Mobat")
- B [harpy](/wiki/Harpy "Harpy")
- B [byakhee](/wiki/Byakhee_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Byakhee (SLASH'EM)")
- B [nightgaunt](/wiki/Nightgaunt_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Nightgaunt (SLASH'EM)")

The bat or bird is the first quest monster class for [Necromancers](/wiki/Necromancer "Necromancer"), and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Necromancer quest](/wiki/Necromancer_quest "Necromancer quest"). Some bats and birds are also generated on a few levels within the quest branch at level creation: five are generated on the home level, and three are placed randomly on the locate level.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds several new monsters to the monster class:

- B [parrot](/wiki/Parrot "Parrot")
- B [crow](/wiki/Crow "Crow")
- B [battle-bat](/wiki/Battle-bat "Battle-bat")
- B [warbat](/wiki/Warbat "Warbat")
- B [chiropteran](/wiki/Chiropteran "Chiropteran")
- B [byakhee](/index.php?title=Byakhee_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Byakhee (dNetHack) (page does not exist)")

The Dreprun [stave](/wiki/Stave "Stave") can be carved into a [wooden](/wiki/Wood "Wood") weapon to ward off bats and birds.

## References

3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/monmove.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 915](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monmove.c#L915)
